subject: RE: [junit] Redirecting Test Output

messageBody:
On Sat, 2004-06-19 at 03:06, Justin Knowlden wrote:
> Under (at least) J2SDK 1.4, you can pass an instance of PrintStream to
> System.setOut(), .setErr(), and .setIn(). For instance, you can do the
> following to capture stdout and stderr:
>
> [...]
> public void testMyTest() throws Exception {
> ByteArrayOutputStream stdout = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
> ByteArrayOutputStream stderr = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
> System.setOut(stdout);
> System.setErr(stderr);
> [...]
> }
> [...]
>
> Replace ByteArrayOutputStream with FileOutputStream to print to a file.
> I haven't checked, but this probably works with JDK 1.3 as well.

It works with at least Java 1.2 and higher. I've done this often; one
thing that I have found to be worthwhile, though, is to put things back
the way I found them after the test. Hence:

public void setUp() {
OutputStream origOut = System.out;
System.setOut(new ByteArrayOutputStream();
}

public void tearDown() {
System.setOut(origOut);
}

that way, the test hopefully won't have any impact on anything that
happens after it completes.
